p: Tilorone was initially identified as an inducer of interferon after oral administration ( 37). The discovery of tilorone was followed by publications describing an ability to induce interferon (IFN) as a possible antiviral mechanism ( 12, 37). Tilorone is water soluble, highly permeable, and is able to penetrate the blood-brain barrier ( 38) which suggests that it could access sites of the body where viruses might hide out.
